intro: Cheiridopsis breachiae, commonly known as the Breach's ice plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape region, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in fine white hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers during the summer months, and it is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in succulent gardens.
